meanings.definition: Relating to the way in which a living organism or bodily part functions.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the patient's physiological response to stress was causing high blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: It is important to understand the physiological needs of plants to help them thrive.
meanings.sent3: The physiological dance between heart and lungs kept the body in perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a physiological reaction to the comedian's jokes.
meanings.sent5: The physiological balance of hormones in the body can impact mood and energy levels.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the normal functions of living organisms and their parts.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the physiological changes in the mice after introducing a new diet.
meanings.sent2: Exercise is essential for maintaining good physiological health.
meanings.sent3: The physiological clock of the body reminded him it was time for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together in perfect physiological harmony to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent5: The physiological processes of digestion are crucial for extracting nutrients from food.
